page.title: 10FARMING INTERVIEW
page.content: {A farmer living in Yeo Vale.} Owns 400 acres of uninterrupted woods and fields around the house. Field size is 4 - 20 acres. Hillsides are too steep for combining so it is wholly dairy; 20 acres are ploughed up each year and returned to grass after a year of Spring barley; this grain is sold and the straw used for bedding or feeding young stock. Forty acres of clay hilltop have never been ploughed and are often too dry or wet for grazing. Keeps l50 Friesian cows, 200 heifers and 20 bullocks and full grown bulls. Calving is mainly in Autumn; rears a bull or two each year to sell, sometimes to the A.I. Centre. Calves have their mother's milk the first week, then a substitute. Keeps within milk quota and bought in an additional one.
